name: Kepler-360
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-360 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-360 is a star with 1.037 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.06 times its radius. It is located 2930.87 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-360 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-360 b

Kepler-360 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.29 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-360.

The mass of Kepler-360 b is 3.19 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-360 b is 1.65 that of Earth. At 3.19 Earth masses, Kepler-360 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-360 c

Kepler-360 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.19 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-360.

The mass of Kepler-360 c is 5.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-360 c is 2.1 that of Earth. At 5.68 Earth masses, Kepler-360 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-360, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
